definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: Slipper dream compared to the people, Kate has overturned that idea.
sentences.chinese: 相比人們的水晶鞋夢，凱特卻顛覆了這種觀念。

sentences.english: Former President George W. Bush called Cronkite "an icon of American journalism."
sentences.chinese: 前總統布什稱克朗凱特爲“美國新聞業的偶像”。

sentences.english: Kate made pasta and roasted red pepper sauce for supper.
sentences.chinese: 凱特爲晚飯做了意式面及烤紅辣椒醬。

sentences.english: We walked hand and hand with Caitlin all the way to the bowling alley.
sentences.chinese: 我們帶着凱特琳一路保齡球場手和手。

sentences.english: The prince apparently held hands with his fiancée as they walked slowly to the island where Princess Diana was laid to rest.
sentences.chinese: 王子與凱特手牽手，慢慢來到黛安娜王妃長眠的小島。

sentences.english: Kate's new boyfriend is a very couth youth.
sentences.chinese: 凱特的新男朋友是一個很有教養的年輕人。

sentences.english: Kate's, what, dress, silk, colour, is.
sentences.chinese: 凱特的綢子連衣裙是什麼顏色？

sentences.english: Kate magnetics would like to sincerely for your service, is willing to do your best matching suppliers.
sentences.chinese: 凱特磁材願真誠爲您服務，願做您最佳的配套供應商。

sentences.english: Field Marshal Keitel described her appearance during an interrogation at Nuremberg.
sentences.chinese: 在紐倫堡一次提審時，凱特爾元帥描述了她的形象。

sentences.english: What the great news for Kate, she has a boy and a daughter now.
sentences.chinese: 對凱特來說這是個多麼好的消息啊，如今她兒女雙全。

sentences.english: Aunt Kat vividly described the huge bonfires and colorful rituals she had witnessed at the Beltane festival in Edinburgh as a girl.
sentences.chinese: 凱特阿姨生動地形容高高的篝火和有趣的典禮。

sentences.english: British England Royal Wedding, William and Kath.
sentences.chinese: 英國皇室婚禮，威廉王子和平民公主凱特。

sentences.english: In today's lesson, Mum will ask Kate about her new friend Zhou Pei.
sentences.chinese: 在今天的課程中，媽媽會問凱特她的新朋友周培。

sentences.english: Kate is a girl with large liquid eyes.
sentences.chinese: 凱特飼一個有一雙水王昔大衍睛的漂諒姑娘。

sentences.english: Switching sports, William and Kate are seen in the paddock enclosure on the first day of the Cheltenham Race Festival in 2007.
sentences.chinese: 威廉和凱特在切爾騰漢姆賽馬節的開幕式上。

definition: Beckenham or Beckham (name)/David Beckham (1975-), British midfield footballer
Moore or Moor (name)/see also 摩爾人|摩尔人[Mo2 er3 ren2]
title of respect for the queen mother or the emperor's father/nickname for Empress Dowager Cixi 慈禧太后[Ci2 xi3 tai4 hou4]
the Franks (Germanic people who arrived in Europe from 600 AD and took over France)
Jeanne d'Arc (1412-1431), French heroine and liberator, executed as a witch by the Burgundians and English/also called Jehanne Darc, the Maid or Orleans, Joan of Arc or St Joan
